result.execSummary:
The defendant William C Melcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants 1 day of jail credit at a rate of $100.00/day towards payment of fine/costs.  Fine to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 11/1/22 and each month thereafter.  Penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.

Costs to be paid along with fine payments.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William C Melcher

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

3:25 PM Defendant William C Melcher in court.  Attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez in court for William C Melcher.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to count #1. Court conducts colloquy and finds the Defendant guilty of count #1. Count #2 and count #3 are dismissed and read-in.

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 
Court orders the following:
	
Count #1:
Fine:  $505.00,
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Credit for 1 day of jail at $100/per day, balance of $605.00 to be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month, starting 11/01/2022 and the 1st of every month until paid in full.
Alternate: entry of civil judgment

Appeal rights given.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

File not called on the record. 
Defendant William C Melcher in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Jack Rieder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Judge Schimel granted the adjournment request off the record. New date set.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from Attorney Gutierrez advising that he is unable to appear at the plea/sentencing hearing and requesting an adjournment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant William C Melcher in court with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:16 PM Defendant William C Melcher in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court quashes the warrant.
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
10:41 AM Defendant William C Melcher not in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
